results.title: Production of foods
results.brief_description: in studying the technology and geography of food production, the following points are given attention: the relation of animal food production to plant food production; methods used to produce plant foods and animal foods; and the important function of the soil in all food production.

results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and P.J. Brook
results.brief_description: A look at the various processes involved in the making of a record - from the artists recording onto multi-track tapes, through to the marketing and distribution to the public. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Production design in The Favourite
results.headline_credit: Ireland, United Kingdom and United States, 2018
results.brief_description: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah’s cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen’s favourite.

constellations_primary.name: The Hatfield House rules
constellations_primary.description: The shooting location of The Favourite, Hatfield House, has appeared in a number of other iconic works.

results.description:
When Australian production designer Fiona Crombie begins work, she asks herself what her design will say about the world of the film. In Yorgos Lanthimos’ award-winning The Favourite, that world is one of competition, intrigue and black comedy, with two rivals fighting for Queen Anne’s (Olivia Colman) influence and affection. 

Though the film is set among the grandeur of an early 18th-century royal court, Crombie didn’t want to overfill the frame. While transforming England’s historic Hatfield House, she stripped out paintings and furniture to leave room to focus on the characters. The details that were added weren’t always historically accurate, like birthday cakes and wheelchairs, but Crombie’s answer to her initial question was to have her design reflect the human heart of the film.
description_for_label:
When Australian production designer Fiona Crombie begins work, she asks herself what her design will say about the world of the film. In Yorgos Lanthimos’ award-winning The Favourite, that world is one of competition, intrigue and black comedy, with two rivals fighting for Queen Anne’s (Olivia Colman) influence and affection. 

Though the film is set among the grandeur of an early 18th-century royal court, Crombie didn’t want to overfill the frame. While transforming England’s historic Hatfield House, she stripped out paintings and furniture to leave room to focus on the characters. The details that were added weren’t always historically accurate, like birthday cakes and wheelchairs, but Crombie’s answer to her initial question was to have her design reflect the human heart of the film.

results.title: Production design in Hollow Knight
results.brief_description: A 2D action game with an emphasis on skill and exploration, Hollow Knight has you fighting a fearsome host of deadly creatures, avoiding intricate traps and solving ancient mysteries as you make your own way through fungal wastes, forests of bone, and ruined underground cities.

constellations_primary.name: City of animals (Hollow Knight - Production Design)
constellations_primary.description: The adorable bugs that occupy Hallownest in the game Hollow Knight aren't the first anthropomorphised critters in film.

results.description:
In the ruined kingdom of Hallownest, a lone hero fights through underground catacombs to discover what happened to this once magnificent world.  

Independent game studio Team Cherry created one of Australia’s biggest breakout hits in recent memory with Hollow Knight. Team Cherry’s Ari Gibson and William Pellen started development by making a central area, called the Forgotten Crossroads, and then built outwards to create a sprawling network of levels for players to unlock and explore. These were first mapped on paper and then each location was given a unique aesthetic, like crystals, forests, fungi and bees. Those areas started as sketches alongside the set decorations that appear in the level, like enemies, trees and other details, which become game assets to populate the world.
description_for_label:
In the ruined kingdom of Hallownest, a lone hero fights through underground catacombs to discover what happened to this once magnificent world.  

Independent game studio Team Cherry created one of Australia’s biggest breakout hits in recent memory with Hollow Knight. Team Cherry’s Ari Gibson and William Pellen started development by making a central area, called the Forgotten Crossroads, and then built outwards to create a sprawling network of levels for players to unlock and explore. These were first mapped on paper and then each location was given a unique aesthetic, like crystals, forests, fungi and bees. Those areas started as sketches alongside the set decorations that appear in the level, like enemies, trees and other details, which become game assets to populate the world.

results.title: Production control. Part II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The three final steps in production control scheduling, despatching, and follow up demonstrates the use of the master schedule and of the shop schedule, and how despatching in both centralised and de-centralised forms.

results.title: Production control. Part I
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The systematic procedure by which management regulates production to meet fluctuating demand consists of four main steps; routing, scheduling, despatching, and follow-up. This film develops the firs step, fully showing the basic importance of routing in manufacture.

results.title: Production control
results.brief_description: Dramatises the case for production control methods, showing the need and effect in a medium-sized firm. Co-ordinating and checking manufacturing processes and reliably assessing priorities makes it possible to avoid excessive delays and pressure of work.

results.title: Production 5118
results.creator_credit: Wilding Picture Productions and Kirby Grant
results.brief_description: Dramatizes incidents to provoke discussion on problems of human communication. Unexpressed misunderstandings between Philip Baxter, a typical executor, and his personnel apply to many situations. After each episode, problems and skills in communication are discussed. In an allegorical sequence, Mr Baxter is judged by a signalman and a jury of his mates for failing to give and receive signals. A solution to the problem of communication is offered by the signalman.
